S_q(p) = \frac{1-\sum_{=1}^n p_i^q}{q-1}. information theory terms, entropy measures uncertainty drawing single transcript gene’s isoform frequency distribution: higher entropy means choice less predictable (many similarly abundant isoforms), lower entropy means distribution dominated one transcripts. Tsallis entropy allows, throught q parameter, shifts emphasis rare abundant isoforms: small values q make measure sensitive low-abundance variants, larger q focus dominant species. practice, computing S_q across short grid q values (“q-curve”) combining resampling paired designs yields concise, interpretable summary isoform heterogeneity. title: TSENAT 0.99.0
text: TSENAT computes Tsallis entropy (S_q) related Hill numbers (D_q) quantify isoform/transcript-level diversity per gene. package accepts matrices, tximport-style lists, SummarizedExperiment objects, returns per-gene diversity assays, provides plotting simple differential-analysis helpers. vignette demonstrates full workflow TCGA Luminal example. Highlights:
code: Core: calculate_tsallis_entropy() — compute S_q and D_q (supports multiple q values and the q->1 Shannon limit). Batch processing: calculate_diversity() applies the calculation across transcripts/genes and returns a SummarizedExperiment with a "diversity" assay. Differential helpers: group comparisons, fold changes and simple tests. Visualizations: density, violin, q-curve, MA, volcano, and top-transcripts plots (return ggplot objects).
